intro: Teclea diversifolia, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are often variegated with shades of green, white, and pink, adding to its ornamental value. Teclea diversifolia thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth.
